CR CR.OPPORTUNITY.DEFINITION CR.OPPORTUNITY.DEFINITION
This function was previously embedded in the CAMPAIGN.DEFINITION table and has been removed to make the process more generic.
The Opportunity Template contains the rules to determine whether an opportunity should be generated for a customer or group of customers. As part of the processing, which may be looped to test against multiple customers, this record is called for a particular customer, to either generate a customer-specific Opportunity record or fail the opportunity for this customer and therefore produce no record :
Much of the information on the template will be copied over to the opportunity itself if a customer is found to match the requirements of the template.

When this template is used to create an opportunity, for outbound communications the system will use one preferred channel which is compatible with customer preferences. However, for an inbound opportunity, multiple channels (as long as they are compatible with the customer’s preferences) may be specified, as we don’t know which method will be used by the customer

:
Allowed input is alpha numeric, and can be any value. However, if the input is either an AA.PRODUCT or an AA.PRODUCT.GROUP (with suffix -GROUP) then this indicates that the opportunity definition is the 'default' definition for that PRODUCT/PRODUCT.GROUP. This will enable automatic defaulting into the OPPORTUNITY record when this PRODUCT or PRODUCT.GROUP is specified. From the point of view of the CR.OPPORTUNITY.DEFINTION validation, if the ID is the same as an AA.PRODUCT record, then the same value must be placed in to the PRODUCT field. If the ID (without suffix -GROUP) is the same as an AA.PRODUCT.GROUP record, then this value will be placed into the PRODUCT.GRP field. If the ID does not link to either PRODUCT or PRODUCT.GROUP, then one of PRODUCT, PRODUCT.GRP or CATEGORY would have to be manually specified.

desc.p: The workflow that will be used, in conjunction with the channel. The opportunity will employ different workflows for each channel used. An opportunity workflow can be appended to both an inbound and an outbound communication. However, only an outbound communication will automatically generate a PW Process. An inbound opportunity will generate an outbound opportunity if the customer indicates that they are interested in the opportunity.
